t: 4:3*r Some Septuagint manuscripts (see also Vulgate); Hebrew father*i
4:4*r Father*i may mean civic*i leader*i or military*i leader*i ; also in verses 12, 14, 17, 18 and possibly elsewhere.
4:9*r Jabez*i sounds like the Hebrew for pain*i .*i
4:12*r Or of*i the*i city*i of*i Nahash*i
4:13*r Some Septuagint manuscripts and Vulgate; Hebrew does not have and*i Meonothai*i .*i
4:14*r Ge*i Harashim*i means valley*i of*i skilled*i workers.*i
4:33*r Some Septuagint manuscripts (see also Joshua 19:8); Hebrew Baal*i
4:41*r The Hebrew term refers to the irrevocable giving over of things or persons to the Lord, often by totally destroying them.
